name: Wien Museum Beethoven Museum
description: A museum capturing one of the world's most famous classical composer's battle with hearing loss.

name: Stubentor Metro Station City Wall Remains
description: These relics of the city's past now exist as a prominent modern feature.

name: Rathaus der Stadt Wien
description: paternoster - A non-stop elevator ride in Vienna's city hall.

name: Strudlhofstiege
description: A set of outdoor stairs named in honor of a famous Austrian artist.

name: Monument Against War and Fascism
description: Designed as a reminder of one of the darkest moments in Austrian history.

name: Österreichisches Staatsarchiv
description:
More than a millennium's worth of municipal records preserve the political history of Austria.
The central reading room on the ground floor and the open access library on the first floor are open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday and Thursday, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tuesday and Wednesday.

name: WIENXTRA-Spielebox
description: Journey through a mesmerizing array of board games inside this museum.

name: Wien Museum Hermesvilla
description: A gift from Emperor Franz Joseph I to his wife.

name: Wotrubakirche - Katholische Kirche zur Heiligsten Dreifaltigkeit
description: This cubist Vienna church building looks like some sort of alien stonehenge.

name: Ausgrabungen Michaelerplatz
description: In the middle of a Vienna square, Roman ruins dating back some 2,000 years are on display.

name: Hochstrahlbrunnen
description: Along the edge of this fountain are 365 smaller fountains that represent the days of the year.

name: Wien Museum Otto Wagner Kirche am Steinhof
description: The first modernist church in Europe.

name: Jubiläumswarte
description: Located right outside of Vienna, visitors can take in expansive views of an ethereal forest.

name: Ernst Fuchs-Museum (Otto-Wagner-Villa)
description: This grand manse has been transformed into a museum devoted to one of the founders of Fantastic Realism.

name: Wien Museum Römermuseum
description: This museum is dedicated to the little known ancient Roman history of Vienna.

name: Neidhart Festsaal (formerly Neidhart Frescoes)
description: A glimpse into the festive and private lives of medieval Europe.

name: Wien Museum Otto Wagner Hofpavillion Hietzing
description: An ornate private entrance to the Vienna subway built specifically for the emperor.

name: Hofjagd- und Rüstkammer
description: A magnificent collection of imperial armor and weaponry.

name: Brennpunkt
description: A history of heat is on display at this unique Austrian museum.

name: Karl Marx-Hof
description:
The housing complex served as an anti-fascist fortress during the Austrian Civil War.
If you’d like to sneak a peek at the building’s past, you can pop into one of its old laundry facilities, which now holds a museum full of information and exhibits about Hof in its heyday.

name: Peace Museum Vienna
description: On a winding Vienna side street, one museum has turned their windows into a monument to history’s peace-minded heroes.

name: Esperanto Museum of the Austrian National Library
description: Museum devoted to the artificial language of Esperanto.

name: MuseumsQuartier Wien
description: This series of Baroque passageways in Vienna's cultural center mix old architecture with modern art.

name: Kunstkammer
description: The Habsburgs' royal collections of art and wonders.

name: Jesuit Church
description: The solemn exterior conceals an opulent interior of this 17th century church.

name: Katholische Kirche Maria Rotunda
description: An exquisite Baroque church in Vienna's old town.

name: Flak tower VIII - G-Tower Arenbergpark
description: Giant WWII fortresses that fired 8,000 rounds a minute, now home to thousands of pigeons.

name: Flakturm VII G-Turm Augarten
description: Giant WWII fortresses that fired 8,000 rounds a minute, now home to thousands of pigeons.

name: Funeral Museum Vienna
description: Collection dedicated to funeral rites, equipment, and mourning rituals of the Viennese.

name: Supersense
description: A neo-Gothic mansion now houses a wunderkammer of analog tech that hits on all the senses.

name: Kugelmugel
description: A spherical "micro-nation" in the heart of Vienna.

name: Votivkirche
description: A neo-Gothic church built to thank God for saving the Emperor of Austria from an assassination.

name: Josephinum
description: One of the best collections of wax anatomical models in the world.

name: Gasometers of Vienna
description: Apartment complexes built into huge repurposed natural gas tanks.

name: Viennese Giant Ferris Wheel
description: Vienna's giant wonder wheel had a starring role in one of the greatest noir movies of all time.

name: Stock-im-Eisen - Nail Tree
description: Legends surround an ancient tree trunk riddled with nails for good luck.

name: Museum of Contraception and Abortion
description: This museum promotes informed contraception by documenting its often secret past.

name: Wolf and Cow Playing Backgammon Mural
description: A silly medieval mural preserved on the side of a Viennese house.

name: Museum of Natural History Vienna
description: Beautiful Austrian natural history museum with carved ceilings and row after row of ancient taxidermy.

name: Vienna Sewer System
description:
Vienna's underworld of tunnels and subterranean rivers made an iconic appearance in a 1949 Orson Welles film.  
Reservation online or via phone is required

name: Column of Pest
description: Baroque celebration of the end of the Great Plague of Vienna.

name: Friedhof der Namenlosen, Vienna
description: The resting place for anonymous victims of the Danube's dark waters.

name: Hundertwasser House
description: Op-art architecture designed for happiness.

name: Spittelau incinerator
description: Op-art architecture designed for happiness. Famed for its golden sphere and colorful smokestack, the district heating plant may be his most striking work of op-art.

name: Museum of Art Fakes
description: This Austrian museum celebrates the work of famous forgers and their inimitable imitations.

name: Globe Museum of the Austrian National Library
description: Handsomely crafted representations of our round planet.

name: Wiener Minoritenkirche
description: art filled church from 1200s

name: St. Stephen's Cathedral
description: The crypt of the imposing Stephensdom holds royal intestines and thousands of skeletons.

name: Sigmund Freud Museum
description: The former private quarters and office of Dr. Sigmund Freud now hosts a museum housing the works of the founding father of psychoanalysis.

name: Maze
description: The topiary maze at the Habsburg hunting lodge.

name: Vienna Crime Museum
description: Macabre museum devoted to historical Viennese murders.

name: St. Charles's Church
description: Built to give thanks for the passing of a plague epidemic, this cathedral is a one-of-a-kind architectural hybrid.

name: Vienna Clock Museum
description: A small museum filled with over 1,000 clocks, and one particular clock calibrated to run until the year 9999.

name: Schmetterlinghaus
description: A tropical paradise just a short trip from the opera house is filled with beautiful winged creatures.

name: Imperial Crypt
description: The final resting place for the remains of 143 Habsburg royalty.

name: Austrian National Library, State Hall
description: The beautiful baroque library of the Hapsburg empire.

name: Schönbrunn Palace
description: WHS - Schönbrunn was the residence of the Habsburg emperors from the 18th century to 1918. It was built in the Rococo style as a single, unified project. It was designed by the architects Johann Bernhard Fischer von Erlach and Nicolaus Pacassi and is the site of the world's oldest continuously operating zoo.[9]

name: Zauberkasten-Museum
description: magic museum

name: Setagayapark
description: Japanese garden

name: Central Cemetery
description: home to wild hamsters

name: Secession
description: t used to be the centre of Avant-Guard art at the end of the 19th Century. Except of Klimt's Beethoven Fries there isn't much of importance to see inside though, but the outside is a good exemplar of this school's revolutionary style.

name: Österreichische Postsparkasse
description: modernist building by Otto Wagner

name: Ringstraße
description: stately boulevard

name: MUK - Alte Musik, Gesang und Oper
Austrian Museum of Folk Life and Folk Art
description: The Austrian Museum of Folk Life and Folk Art is one of Europe’s major international ethnographic museums with extensive collections of folk art as well as historical and contemporary everyday cultures. A permanent exhibition as well as changing special exhibitions deal with various topics of coexistence in a constantly changing world

name: Hundertwasser Village
description: Hundertwasser designed shops from former factory
